poem:
Title: In the Midst of Market Shakes

Business murmurs in the cool grey light,
Growth in uncertain slumber, plans go astray.
Bank of England softly sighs tonight,
By the dim glow of economy's ballet.
In the flash of a survey, wisdom distilled,
A slow rhythm of numbers, silently thrilled.
In the echo of the shares, a tale retold,
Of dreams auctioned, ambitions bought and sold.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK company growth slows in blow to Sunak; NatWest share sale threatened by general election – business live 10.01am BST Today’s May flash PMI survey will have provided the Bank of England with some comfort after the stronger-than-expected inflation data for April, says Capital Economics. They told clients: Crucially, the further fall in the services output prices balance suggests that services inflation will continue to drop. The output and activity balances were also weaker than". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
